NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Repair and maintenance services of building installations

TI_TEXT.P: Услуги по поддържане и експлоатация на спортни обекти и съоръжения
Servicios de explotación de instalaciones deportivas
Servizi di gestione di impianti sportivi
Serviços de exploração de instalações desportivas
Servicii de gestionare a complexelor sportive

TITLE.P: Operator Concession for Sunderland Parklife Football Hubs

SHORT_DESCR.P: Sunderland City Council and its partners the Football Association, Durham County Football Association Ltd, and The Foundation of Light have identified 3 sites in Sunderland for development into Football Hubs, as part of the Football Association, Sport England and The Premier League’s “Parklife” project.

The Project will support sustainable grassroots provision in the City with investment in strategic sites with Artificial Grass Pitches, grass pitches and ancillary facilities that can support extensive training and match play, as well as coaching, education and Football Development initiatives.

The Council, procuring in partnership with the Sunderland Football Trust, is seeking to procure an operator to manage the Football Hub facilities. Construction of the Hubs is not in scope of this opportunity.
The concession is to be awarded to one operator, who will be required to enter into contracts with the Council and Sunderland Football Trust in respect of both Lots.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: The contracting authority will be awarding the contracts for both lots to one contractor.

Contractors should note that both concession lots will be awarded to a single preferred bidder, who will be required to enter into contracts with the Sunderland Football Trust for Lot 1 and The Council for Lot 2

TITLE.P: Operator Concession for Sunderland Parklife Northern Area and Ford Quarry Football Hubs

MAIN_SITE.P: Ford Quarry, Keelman’s Lane, Sunderland, SR4 0JW and Northern Area Playing Fields, Stephenson Road, Washington, NE37 3HR

SHORT_DESCR.P: Sunderland City Council and its partners have identified 3 initial sites in Sunderland which are to be developed as Football Hubs, as part of the delivery of the Parklife project.
— The Sunderland Parklife scheme focuses on the development of these football hub sites,
— Northern Area in Washington,
— expansion of the Community North site in Downhill and the Ford Quarry site.
The proposed contract is divided into lots.
Lot 1 will include the operation and management of the Northern Area and Ford Quarry Hubs, with the contract for Lot 1 to be entered into between the Contractor and the Sunderland Football Trust.

Contractors should note that both concession lots will be awarded to a single preferred bidder, who will be required to enter into contracts with the Council and Sunderland Football Trust in respect of both of the aforementioned Lots.
More details are contained with the procurement documents.

TITLE.P: Operator Concession for Sunderland Parklife Community North Football Hubs

MAIN_SITE.P: Community North Sports Complex, Kingsway Road, Sunderland, SR5 4BB

SHORT_DESCR.P: Sunderland City Council and its partners have identified three initial sites in Sunderland which are to be developed as Football Hubs, as part of the delivery of the Parklife project.
— The Sunderland Parklife scheme focuses on the development of these football hub sites,
— Northern Area in Washington,
— expansion of the Community North site in Downhill and the Ford Quarry site.
The proposed contract is divided into lots.
Lot 2 will comprise the operation and management of the Community North Hub, with a contract for Lot 2 to be entered into between the Contractor and the Council.

Contractors should note that both concession lots will be awarded to a single preferred bidder, who will be required to enter into contracts with the Council and Sunderland Football Trust in respect of both of the aforementioned Lots.
More details are contained with the procurement documents.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: As stated in the procurement documents

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: High Court of England and wales
ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.ADDRESS: Royal Courts of Justice, The Strand

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Any appeals should be promptly brought to the attention of the Contracting Authority (at the address specified in Section I) above, and will be dealt with in accordance with the requirements of the Concession Contract Regulations 2016. Any appeals must be brought within the time-scales specified by the applicable law, including, without limitation, the Concession Contract Regulations 2016. In accordance with such Regulations, the Contracting Authority will also incorporate a minimum 10 calendar day standstill period from the date information on award of the concession is communicated to tenderers
